programme.title: CBC News Network with Andrew Nichols
programme.desc: CBC News Network showcases the best of CBC journalism, covering stories with speed, and adding context and meaning along the way. Live from our bureaus across Canada and around the world, with anchor Andrew Nichols.(n)

programme.title: Wales in Lockdown
programme.desc: Self-filmed footage from behind closed doors of families, businesses, frontline workers and others, over weeks, capturing over a number of weeks how they are coping with the measures brought in to help beat the Covid-19 pandemic. Hannah Daniel narrates.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Coronavirus Crisis: Europe's Migrant Camps - Panorama
programme.desc: Said Reza Adib investigates conditions inside Greek migrant camps, locked down as coronavirus spread across the world, with vulnerable people havinge to share taps and toilets with those who have tested positive for the virus. Strict quarantine is enforced on camps where coronavirus cases are confirmed, leading to some shortages in food, water and medical care inside. The programme hears from charity and public health experts who warn that any failure to control the spread of the virus inside the camps could lead to potentially dangerous outbreaks.(n)

programme.desc: The latest information and health advice on Coronavirus, including what the symptoms are, and how to self-isolate. Presented by Victoria Derbyshire.(n)

programme.desc: Mark Kermode gives his unique take on the best and worst of the week's film and DVD releases.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents from Brighton Racecourse, with experts Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey helping the teams. Charlie Ross also visits the National Horseracing Museum.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers visit Ellesmere Port, where Rachael, Lyndsey and daughter Missy-Mae want a garden to match their fun-loving personalities.(n)

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. In the Amazon, a female spider monkey elder leads its troop to aquatic plants brought within reach on raging floodwaters and shows them how they can feast on this unlikely bounty by using their remarkable tails as safety ropes.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament, with David Cornock.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The last quarter-final sees amateur designers transforming two rooms in 1930s art deco flats. One hopeful takes a risk by introducing a 'mock crocodile' pattern to their client's gentlemen's club brief, while the other's butterfly-inspired effect seems a little too dominant. However, the challenge is really on for one designer when a possible asbestos outbreak means work has to be halted. Will they get finished on time? Presented by Tom Dyckhoff, with judges Kelly Hoppen and Daniel Hopwood.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash. As the teams solve the passwords, they win letters that will help them later in the game, giving them a better chance of cracking the final password which unlocks the Letterbox holding the cash prize. However, if they end up as the losing pair along the way, they'll have to surrender all the letters they've won to the winning pair - who will then go through to the semi-final eliminator round.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores some of western Europe's most dramatic shorelines, telling stories, investigating notable landmarks and exploring natural enigmas that have played an important role in the region's development. This edition focuses on the mysteries of the British Isles.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms narrates a history of Westerns, featuring archive interviews with stars including Gary Cooper, James Stewart, Yul Brynner, Paul Newman, John Wayne and Clint Eastwood.(n)

programme.title: Wagon Master
programme.desc: Two itinerant cowboys help guide a Mormon wagon train on its dangerous journey west in search of the promised land, crossing paths with travelling entertainers, rowdy gunfighters, cut-throat natives and a fugitive band of ruthless outlaws. John Ford's Western, starring Ben Johnson, Joanne Dru, Ward Bond, Harry Carey Jr and Charles Kemper.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Claire Rawle and Jonathan Pratt assess items brought to the RAF Museum in Cosford, Shropshire, while Paul Martin finds out about saddlemaking in Dudley.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Chizzy Akudolu, Charlie Higson, Kate Williams and Tom Allen go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Heroes
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble celebrate the stars of Longleat, beginning by meeting the dedicated keepers who have been rehabilitating Asian elephant Annie - a former circus animal that was abused and mistreated.(n)

programme.title: Dig WW2 with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian explores Northern Ireland's role in the Second World War, revealing the story of a pilot who became the most successful U-boat hunter of all time. The programme also examines Harland & Wolff's contributions to the development of the famous Churchill tank, and takes an underwater look at the wreck of the U-155. In Donegal, a major excavation reveals the 70-year-old Spitfire flown by American pilot Bud Wolfe, who was forced to bail out just minutes after taking off.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.sub-title: The Best of RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift take a look back over the last decade of world-class design and horticulture from the RHS Chelsea Flower Show from their own gardens, beginning by celebrating the very best of British. From roses to royalty, they reveal more about the people and plants that fuel the nation's obsession with gardening, and meet the designers and the passionate people inspired by the UK's rich history and landscape.(n)

programme.title: Monkman & Seagull's Genius Adventures
programme.desc: Eric Monkman and Bobby Seagull travel around Britain as they explore their favourite scientific breakthroughs, beginning with the 18th-century inventions that kick-started the Industrial Revolution and transformed scientific understanding. They head to Derbyshire to investigate Richard Arkwright's water frame - a spinning machine that allowed cotton textiles to be mass-produced, and then examine James Watt's separate condenser, an unassuming invention that would be the biggest single improvement ever made to the steam engine.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme 'Overseas', in an extended edition of the unorthodox quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Being Gail Porter
programme.desc: For the first time, Gail Porter opens up about her past, hoping to understand her rise to celebrity and her fall into depression, anorexia, self-harming and homelessness.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Three farm managers, all critical to the running of their businesses, attend an agricultural awards ceremony in London, where they battle it out for Farm Manager of the Year.(n)

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The final leg of the journey takes in Morocco, where Simon visits a land borders between Africa and the European Union, and the coast of Spain, taking in the scale of the country's fruit and vegetable industry. He discovers why tourists are actively discouraged from visiting Corsica, and goes diving in waters that have the highest fish population in the Mediterranean.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp and Britain's Volunteer Army
programme.desc: The actor celebrates the efforts of some of the UK's 750,000 volunteers during the coronavirus crisis,, and also lends a hand in his own neighbourhood..(n)

programme.title: Your Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman and the team give horticultural tips and advice to viewers, hoping to give them the inspiration to create their own summer gardens, beginning by showing how to make the most of colour.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: More family heirlooms are restored, including an antique skeleton clock, a giant teddy bear and a transistor radio with huge sentimental value to its owner.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: It's the semi-final, where two designers compete for a place in the finale. In an added twist, one of the returning contestants has been given a second chance, a 'wildcard' entry into the semi-finals, having been eliminated from the previous rounds. The competitors have 48 hours to transform a couple of rooms in modern Bristol town houses before Kelly Hoppen, Daniel Hopwood and guest judge Michelle Ogundehin decide who goes through to the next stage. Tom Dyckhoff presents.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc, as pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Dreams Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to help more amateur horticulturists transform their small or average-sized plots into something extraordinary. In Salisbury, newly engaged couple Glenn and Zoe want a new garden to produce flowers for their wedding, but their sloping plot seems completely unusable. Monty has the ideas and plenty of enthusiasm, but can they get the planting done in time for the wedding? In Barnet, he gets to work on an overgrown allotment that owner Nighat wants to use as a site for keeping bees, as well for growing fruit and vegetables.(n)

programme.title: The Sky's the Limit
programme.desc: A Second World War hero returns home to New York and sneaks into town incognito to avoid a big fuss. He meets the girl of his dreams, but his efforts to court her are thwarted when she leaps to the conclusion that he is a coward trying to get out of going to war. Romantic musical comedy, starring Fred Astaire and Joan Leslie, with an appearance by bandleader Freddie Slack.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner invites Tony Blackburn to take him back to the home his father designed in Poole, Dorset. The pair also visit the nearby beach where Tony used to sell ice-cream in the school holidays, and Bournemouth Pavilion where he learned the ropes as a performer and entertainer. Brian cooks a nostalgic dessert to remind Tony of his mother's cooking, and creates a culinary tribute - which puts the veteran disc jockey's life on a plate.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents highlights from some of the historic venues up and down the country and goes behind the scenes of Bamburgh Castle in Northumberland.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kate Williams, Tom Allen, Chizzy Akudolu and Charlie Higson continue testing their general knowledge skills in assorted trivia-based games before Friday's final.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Heroes
programme.desc: Jean Johansson gives an anteater a wash, while Ben Fogle and Kate Humble celebrate the life of Nico, Longleat Safari Park's legendary silverback gorilla.(n)

programme.title: Dig WW2 with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian heads out to sea to hear the story of the Empire Heritage, a cargo ship filled with Sherman tanks sunk off Malin Head during the Battle of the Atlantic in 1944. He gets the opportunity to fly a Second World War aircraft while visiting an RAF flying boat base on Lough Erne, and meets the experts intent on discovering the identities of the remains of soldiers killed during the conflict.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.sub-title: The Best of RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift embark on a horticultural trip around the globe at the world-famous flower show, discovering the people and plants that make it an international event. They are joined by Carol Klein, Adam Frost and the team to meet the international fleet of designers and plantspeople who travel thousands of miles to bring fresh ideas and fabulous floral creations to the show each year.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Coronavirus: A Horizon Special - Part Two
programme.desc: Dr Chris van Tulleken, Dr Hannah Fry and Michael Mosley examine the latest research and explore some of the big questions about Covid-19 and the pandemic it has created. Michael visits the UK government's high-security laboratory Porton Down, where vaccines are being tested. He also uncovers what the experience of the 2002 SARs epidemic reveals about this one. Both were caused by coronaviruses, but certain key changes to today's virus have allowed it to infect the world, where SARs was contained.(n)

programme.title: I'll Get This - Extra Helping
programme.desc: Rob Beckett, Joanna Scanlan, Martin Kemp, Harry Redknapp and Victoria Coren Mitchell go for dinner together. They must place their bank card in the centre of the restaurant table. As the food is served and the drinks flow, they play a series of fun and revealing games, and if they win, they can retrieve their card. The person whose card remains at the end of the evening must pick up the bill for the whole group.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events.(n)

programme.title: David Harewood: Psychosis and Me
programme.desc: At the age of 23, David Harewood had a psychotic breakdown and was sectioned. Two years ago he opened up on Twitter about the experience - and now he wants to tell the full story. Travelling back to his home town of Birmingham, the actor lets viewers into the realities of experiencing a psychotic breakdown, and how much he blocked out at the time, meeting up with his mother and old friends who were with him at the time. But this isn't just his story. He also spends time with other young people living with psychosis and the NHS professionals who treat them.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The contestants are asked to insert an invisible zip and pockets on a pair of palazzo pants, while the judges keep a keen eye on how well they pattern-match the bold prints. For the transformation challenge, the sewers must turn towels into stylish beach cover-ups in just 90 minutes. Male models arrive in the Sewing Room for the final challenge, ready to be fitted with a made-to-measure holiday shirt using bright and colourful fabrics. Whose shirt will bring on the sunshine, and who will be sent packing?(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: The team makes creative gardening use of the contents of our bins and answers viewers' gardening questions via a virtual Q&A.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary returns to follow the day-to-day realities the NHS faces in tackling the coronavirus pandemic, following staff and patients at London's Royal Free Trust from the first day of the lockdown. The Royal Free Hospital's emergency department is inundated with patients displaying symptoms, among them 88-year-old Peter, who is struggling for breath. He is quickly put on oxygen and moved to what was the coronary care unit, but has now become a ward for covid-positive patients.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp and Britain's Volunteer Army
programme.desc: The actor celebrates the heroic efforts of some of the UK's 750,000 volunteers during the coronavirus crisis.(n)

programme.title: Your Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman, Harry and David Rich, Rachel de Thame, Toby Buckland and James Wong help viewers make the most of the space in their garden - whatever its size.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison use virtual reality to redesign a 1930s Surrey house with a poorly designed layout to make better use of the space, and allow the owners to both start a family and have their parents move in with them in the future. Laura's plan involves turning the property into a light-filled interconnected series of spaces, while Robert turns conventional wisdom on its head with a visually striking and flexible design. After experiencing both potential houses, the owners must choose which they would like to put into practice.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: In the penultimate show, the pressure mounts as the two designers go head to head for a place in the final. They are given the challenge to transform two rooms, a living room and a dining room, in a traditional thatched cottage in Ashby St Ledgers, Northamptonshire, with only 48 hours to complete the task and a budget of £2,000 for both rooms.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc, as pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash. As the teams solve the passwords, they win letters that will help them later in the game, giving them a better chance of cracking the final password which unlocks the Letterbox holding the cash prize. However, if they end up as the losing pair along the way, they'll have to surrender all the letters they've won to the winning pair - who will then go through to the semi-final eliminator round.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Dreams Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don helps young couple Jack and Chris in Clapham to turn their tiny urban back space into a Victorian-inspired plant collector's paradise - with a twist. However, their timing is not perfect, as they are aiming to add a special dahlia collection, a fern wall and lots of modern gardening gadgets at the same time as refurbishing their home. Meanwhile, in Hereford, daughter Frankie is trying to renovate her cottage garden in memory of her sister, with the help of her mother Pat, but her ambitious plans clash with Monty's more practical approach.(n)

programme.title: Vivacious Lady
programme.desc: A professor falls in love with a brash nightclub singer while on a trip to New York, and impulsively marries her. However, he is afraid his conservative family will not approve of his new wife, so tries to keep the relationship a secret from them. Romantic comedy, with Ginger Rogers and James Stewart.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Johnny Ball on a trip to his childhood home of Bristol, where he recalls his love of maths challenges in the classroom and the impact of ration books on the supply of sweets at his local corner shop.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A collection of previously unseen finds from the show's travels round the country, visiting St Albans Cathedral, Wolverhampton Art Gallery, and Packwood House in Warwickshire.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Chizzy Akudolu, Charlie Higson, Kate Williams and Tom Allen go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Heroes
programme.desc: Ben Fogle tries to mend his relationship with Rio the Cockatoo. Kate Humble discovers more about a giraffe that arrived in the 1960s, and cameras reveal feeding time in a new light.(n)

programme.title: Dig WW2 with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian travels to Lough Foyle to explore the history of a Flying Fortress that crashed while travelling from America to an air force base near Bedford. He unearths the stories of the crew's survival against the odds and learns how a local woman and her boat contributed to their rescue. He also visits the disused Cluntoe airfield in Co Tyrone, where RAF pilots were trained for flying missions all over Europe, and looks back at the climatic end to the Battle of the Atlantic on the River Foyle docks.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.sub-title: The Best of RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift reveal the trendsetters amongst the designers and growers at the RHS Chelsea Flower Show, and discover who has influenced our gardening habits. Elsewhere, fashion designer Paul Smith shares what inspires him at the show year after year.(n)

programme.title: Vienna Blood
programme.desc: Oskar is called away from Max and Clara's engagement party to investigate the brutal murders of three women in a brothel. Clara understands Max's eagerness to join the investigation and allows him to follow, much to the detective's dismay. The police almost immediately arrest Victor Krull, a man who regularly visited the brothel and took a particular interest in one of the victims, whose body has been washed and ritualistically displayed. The press are informed of the arrest, but Max is not at all convinced.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Shorts
programme.desc: A filmic offshoot of Tim Key's stage show Megadate, in which a man dazzles a woman on the perfect first date. However, she doesn't text him back, leading him to retrace his steps. His path is riddled with cynics and naysayers, questioning his optimistic outlook on how the date went. The nerd in the bowling alley who thought he'd embarrassed himself, the old eel catcher on the mud flats trying to douse his dreams with wisdom, and the compassionate waitress at the chicken shop. Starring Tim Key, Mandeep Dhillon, Sam Fletcher, Bill Paterson and Julie Dray.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events.(n)

programme.title: Alastair Campbell: Depression and Me
programme.desc: The journalist and former Downing Street press secretary - best known as Tony Blair's 'spin doctor' during his tenure as prime minister - talks about his lifelong battle with depression. Encouraged by his family, Alastair sets out on a journey to explore if cutting-edge science can offer him, and the millions of people like him, the hope of one day living free of the illness. As he tries to better understand his depression, he also reflects on key events in his life and asks if they could have had a negative effect on his mind.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five teams are reunited and look back on their journey, recalling the highs and lows, and sharing memories of the people who helped them along the way. They also reveal what their first impressions of each other were, and how those views were changed by the challenges they all had to face.(n)

programme.title: Saved on Camera
programme.desc: A plane crash in Quebec leaves a pilot stranded, an injured hiker drags himself three kilometres to safety in the Australian Outback and a brother saves his sibling who has lost consciousness on a free dive in the Bahamas. Narrated by Kevin Duala.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: The second of two programmes following hospital staff treating Covid-19 cases features patients who are on dialysis or who have recently had a transplant, and as such are among the most vulnerable to the virus. Royal Free London faces a near catastrophic breakdown of oxygen supply, while an infectious diseases consultant starts a trial of an anti-viral drug used in the treatment of Ebola.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp and Britain's Volunteer Army
programme.desc: The actor celebrates the heroic efforts of some of the UK's 750,000 volunteers during the coronavirus crisis.(n)

programme.title: Your Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman and the team highlight Chelsea designer ideas for supporting wildlife in your garden, and reveal some of the best flowers to attract pollinators.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: In a special edition, Fiona Bruce marks the 75th anniversary of VE Day, looking back at objects featured on the programme that gave personal insights into the momentous events of the Second World War. There is first-hand testimony from those who were present at VE Day, including the Roadshow's own Henry Sandon, while Fiona also delves into the BBC archives to discover the challenges of reporting the announcement and the celebrations across the UK and abroad.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The remaining two designers battle to be crowned champion in the grand final of the competition. Standing in between them and the title is the challenge of transforming three rooms in apartments in an 18th-century mock castle in Broadstairs. To make the challenge more difficult than ever, the rooms are larger than before and for the first time, each designer will be tackling a kitchen. As the race for the title nears its end, the pair must impress Daniel Hopwood and Kelly Hoppen, as well as former judge and interior stylist Sophie Robinson. Presented by Tom Dyckhoff.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Dreams Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don helps Bromley couple Mei and Gerard with their ambitious plan to turn their narrow, split-level garden into a Japanese-style paradise, complete with mountain stream, mossy boulders and traditional plants. But with tons of soil to move and their budget running out, it seems they have bitten off more than they can chew. In Stoke, artists Anna and Andrew want to transform their concrete yard into a haven of tranquillity with something beautiful to see in every corner. However, they will need to use all their creative flair - not to mention Monty's expert advice - to avoid overcrowding this very small space.(n)

programme.title: Beautiful But Dangerous
programme.desc: An heiress returns to her home town to shower gifts on the people who donated money in order for her to undergo a life-saving operation when she was a child. However, the woman is not prepared for the consequences of her good deed. Comedy drama, starring Jean Simmons, Robert Mitchum, Arthur Hunnicutt and Edgar Buchanan.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Falklands War veteran and charity campaigner Simon Weston takes Brian Turner back to his childhood home of Nelson, in Caerphilly, where the chef prepares two dishes from his youth.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charles Hanson and Adam Partridge unearth all manner of items to auction in Morecambe, Lancashire, including French porcelain and Japanese carvings. Plus, presenter Paul Martin visits the railway station that acted as the set for the iconic film Brief Encounter.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Chizzy Akudolu, writer and actor Charlie Higson, historian Kate Williams and comedian Tom Allen take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Heroes
programme.desc: A new troop of colobus monkeys move onto Gorilla Island and keeper Rachel is locked in a battle of wills with Dave the Canadian timberwolf.(n)

programme.title: Front Row Late
programme.desc: Mary and her guests, including artistic director of the Young Vic theatre Kwame Kwei-Armah, discuss the long-term effects of Covid-19 on the future of performance, and what culture might mean once the current lockdown is lifted. There is also a performance from actors Emma Thompson and Greg Wise.(n)

programme.title: War Walks
programme.desc: Richard Holmes recalls the night of December 29, 1940, when St Paul's Cathedral and much of London suffered heavy bombing, tracing events surrounding the terrible destruction caused during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.sub-title: The Best of RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift celebrate the positive power of plants as they focus on the designers and growers striving for a better world with the creations they bring to the event. They reveal how, over the years, the show has contributed to the better promotion of the health of the planet, plants and people, and talk to Countryfile presenter Ellie Harrison and BBC correspondent Fergal Keane about the importance of gardens to mental wellbeing.(n)

programme.title: What's the Matter with Tony Slattery
programme.desc: Tony Slattery was one of the most gifted TV comedians of the late 1980s and early 1990s, only to disappear from screens in 1996 amid rumours of a massive breakdown. As he approaches 60, he has been touring the country with a show that explores his past and his mental health. Although depression was diagnosed, he and his partner Mark Hutchinson are convinced he may have bipolar disorder, so Tony wants to have his mental health reassessed. But it will mean opening up about his addictions and a painful event in his childhood.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Noel Fielding, Dane Baptiste, Al Porter
programme.desc: One half of The Mighty Boosh and co-host of The Great British Bake Off Noel Fielding takes over the hosting reins of the long-running show as he comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The comedian, actor, artist, DJ and musician treats the audience to his own peculiar brand of surreal humour, before introducing routines by two up-and-coming stars of the comedy circuit, with south Londoner Dane Baptiste and Irishman Al Porter taking to the stage at the famous venue.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's national and international events, with Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Monkman & Seagull's Genius Adventures
programme.desc: Eric Monkman and Bobby Seagull travel around Britain as they explore their favourite scientific breakthroughs, beginning with the 18th-century inventions that kick-started the Industrial Revolution and transformed scientific understanding. They head to Derbyshire to investigate Richard Arkwright's water frame - a spinning machine that allowed cotton textiles to be mass-produced, and then examineJames Watt's separate condenser, an unassuming invention that would be the biggest single improvement ever made to the steam engine.(n)

programme.title: Growing Up Gifted
programme.desc: Part two of two. The conclusion of the documentary follows three gifted teenage girls, Anne Marie, Jada and Shakira, as they make decisions about their futures. In Port Talbot, Anne Marie is more settled after moving in with her best friend, but isolation from her family and nerves about her exams are starting to trouble her. Meanwhile, would-be paediatrician Jada has her heart set on taking her A Levels at grammar school, and Tamworth-based Shakira has got to make up lost ground if she is to achieve the high grades her teachers have predicted.(n)

programme.title: Lee Miller - A Life on the Front Line
programme.desc: Lee Miller is one of the most remarkable female icons of the 20th century. A fashion model-turned-photographer, then later a war reporter, Miller chose to live life by her own rules. This documentary drama celebrates a subject who defied anyone who tried to pin her down, put her on a pedestal or pigeonhole her in any way. Often at odds with the morality of the day, she refused to be subjugated by the dominant male figures around her.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp and Britain's Volunteer Army
programme.desc: The actor and film-maker celebrates the efforts of some of the UK's 750,000 volunteers, joining them as they help with everything from shopping to delivering hospital equipment.(n)

programme.title: Your Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman presents a selection of ideas for making the most of a budget, looking back at inexpensive landscaping techniques from past medal-winning gardens. Plus, packing borders or containers without breaking the bank and making displays from cheap bunches of flowers.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a factory in Essex that produces 400,000 cereal bars a day, and follows the production process from the arrival of the ingredients to the eventual dispatch, discovering the importance of getting the perfect balance between honey and glucose. Cherry Healey travels to South Africa to help with the macadamia harvest, where a quarter of the world's supply of these nuts are farmed. Historian Ruth Goodman climbs a mountain in the Lake District to investigate the history of one of the oldest forms of snack bar - the Kendal Mint Cake.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Puerto Rico: Island of Enchantment - Natural World
programme.desc: After being colonised by humans, Puerto Rico's rich natural resources were rapidly exploited for agriculture, industry and urban development. This documentary follows a conservation team fighting to save the most endangered creatures from extinction after they have been pushed to the edge of existence by human encroachment. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts a game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Tale of Five Temples: The Story of Hinduism in Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the history of five Hindu temples across Britain, tracing their stories and the spread of Hinduism in the UK. Featuring the elaborate rituals and the moving stories of Hindu worshippers, the film gives an insight into the sheer variety of Hindu beliefs across Britain. Narrated by Naga Munchetty.(n)

programme.title: Astaire and Rogers Sing the Great American Songbook
programme.desc: A compilation of hits performed by Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, all written by renowned American songwriters including George and Ira Gershwin, Irving Berlin, Jerome Kern and Dorothy Fields, Harold Arlen and Johnny Mercer.(n)

programme.title: Carefree
programme.desc: A woman has doubts about her impending wedding and pays a visit to her fiance's therapist friend. However, the counselling does not go to plan and she develops romantic feelings for the doctor, forcing him to resort to hypnotism to cure her infatuation - with unforeseen consequences. Musical comedy, starring Fred Astaire, Ginger Rogers and Ralph Bellamy.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner invites actor and TV presenter Christopher Biggins to reminisce about his youth in Salisbury. He describes a flamboyant childhood, where he developed an early taste for the high life and was taught the appreciation of food by larger-than-life aunts and grannies. The chef then cooks two nostalgic, mouth-watering dishes, hoping to transport Biggins back to happy times.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin is joined by antiques experts James Lewis and Caroline Hawley at Wolverhampton Art Gallery, which boasts an extensive collection of paintings. Turning up out of the hundreds of bags and boxes is a sword with a dark history and an early Moorcroft vase. Host Paul also explores some of the region's industrial past.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Chizzy Akudolu, author and comedian Charlie Higson, historian Kate Williams and comedian Tom Allen take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, culminating in the week's winner being crowned.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Heroes
programme.desc: Longleat keeper Caleb wants to find out who are the heroes and who are the zeros in lion country with a test of their intelligence. Calling on departments from across the estate, he tries to create a contraption that will see the lions work together as a team to release their food. Meanehile, Ben Fogle tries to mend his ways with Rio the tearaway cockatoo and Longleat's very own spiderman tries to save a rare arachnid.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef's culinary travels take him through Mexico City, and Puebla, where he samples Mexico's most iconic dish, the meat stew mole. Later, in the deserts of Oaxaca, he discovers how one of the country's most famous drinks, mezcal is made.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.sub-title: The Best of RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and the team look at the legends and legacies that have made the Chelsea Flower Show the greatest event in the horticultural calendar. They discover what it takes to become an icon at this show, talk to the Chelsea designers and plants men and women that have broken records, won global recognition and inspired generations of gardeners. Plus, how movers and shakers from other creative fields have been influenced by their visits to the event over the years.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With lockdown affecting new filming, Monty Don is at Longmeadow to take an indulgent, horticultural romp through the Gardeners' World archives. From delphiniums to clematis, irises, orchids and dahlias expert growers share their passion along with hints and tips. Plus, Carol Klein visits a garden in Shropshire where she discovers picture perfect plant combinations, Adam Frost travels to the Cotswolds and finds out what happens when plants are brought together with imagination and daring and Nick Bailey offers a guide to the world of Britain's favourite flower - the rose.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The host reinvents his music show to accommodate the requirements of the lockdown, joined - virtually - in this edition by grime pioneer Dizzee Rascal. The east London rapper talks through his musical journey and some of the artists that were part of it, illustrated by clips from the BBC archives. His choices reflect the diverse array of genres from indie to grime and jazz, that have influenced his music, alongside memories from a career that kicked off with his Mercury Prize-winning debut Boy in Da Corner in 2003. Plus, as part of the show's focus on new music and artists, a unique performance by a contemporary artist.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, with Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: A team of investigative reporters for a Boston newspaper investigate reports of children being molested within the Catholic church. The journalists discover the situation is far worse than it seemed, as they find a conspiracy among the city's legal, religious and government establishments to cover up decades of abuse. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Mark Ruffalo, Michael Keaton, Rachel McAdams and Stanley Tucci.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a scene that shows even a tiny shanty by a pond can be a warm place in the dead of winter.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod examines the evolution of skin - the largest organ in any creature's body - across all species of the animal kingdom, beginning by looking at how that of vertebrates has allowed them to conquer the planet..(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's History of Modern Britain
programme.desc: The journalist considers whether the often-accepted view that Britain entered a golden age in the 1950s glosses over the social and racial tensions of the decade. He also examines how the new breed of 1960s satirists taught the public to laugh at their rulers and how factions including the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament began to protest against those in power.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Tom Baker narrates a programme examining the evolution of the loaf in Britain and how the bread that people consumed in the past had a lot to say about their social status. From the time when white bread was exclusively for the rich, to the moment when dietary experts recommended brown loaves for better health, this documentary explains how habits in buying and eating bread have changed.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: The Changin' Times of Ike White - Arena
programme.desc: Documentary in which Dan Vernon tries to track down Ike White, a musical prodigy who was serving life in prison for murder when he was given the opportunity to record an album. The resulting record Changin' Times came out in 1976 and following his release from prison, Whiteseemed to be on the path to redemption, but just as he was charting a course to stardom, he disappeared.(n)

programme.title: Morocco to Timbuktu: An Arabian Adventure
programme.desc: Writer and explorer Alice Morrison embarks on a camel trek over the dunes of the Sahara, 3.5 million square miles of desert, for the second and final part of her journey to Timbuktu. Along the way she visits a livestock market that centuries ago provided merchants with their camels, before reaching her final destination. Far from the legendary City of Gold, Timbuktu is a city where UN solders keep a fragile peace after an incursion by Islamic extremists in 2012. Alice relives the city's glorious past with a visit to its world famous mosques, meets the Tuaregs - desert nomads who have sought refuge in there - and celebrates at a party with her newfound friends.(n)

programme.title: Elegance and Decadence: The Age of the Regency
programme.sub-title: The Many and the Few - A Divided Decade
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley reviews the final years of George's time as Prince Regent, which culminated in his coronation as King George IV in 1821. Writers including Lord Byron and Percy and Mary Shelley railed against his excesses, while industrial technologies transformed the British landscape - but rapidly expanding cities like Birmingham, Liverpool and Manchester remained unrepresented in Parliament due to the country's archaic form of government.(n)

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore follows the Habsburgs to their dramatic demise. From his struggles with Napoleon III and Bismarck and the suicide of his son Rudolf, to the assassination of his beautiful wife Sisi, Emperor Franz Josef's empire and his family proved impossible to control - but while the Habsburgs headed for extinction, Vienna blossomed.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a scene that shows even a tiny shanty by a pond can be a warm place in the dead of winter.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's History of Modern Britain (?)
programme.desc: The journalist considers whether the often-accepted view that Britain entered a golden age in the 1950s glosses over the social and racial tensions of the decade. He also examines how the new breed of 1960s satirists taught the public to laugh at their rulers and how factions including the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament began to protest against those in power.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting (?)
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross paints an old dirt road leading up to a quaint country barn nestled in nature's greenery.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Skin (?)
programme.desc: Ben Garrod explores how skin has evolved to enable animals to move in a range of habitats, revealing how adaptations allow birds to fly, sharks to speed through water and sugar gliders to take to the air..(n)

programme.title: Chemistry - A Volatile History (?)
programme.desc: Professor of Theoretical Physics Jim Al-Khalili follows in the footsteps of the pioneers who discovered and mapped the elements, examining why the belief that there were only four of them - earth, fire, air and water - lasted until the 19th century. He also investigates the rivalries that dogged scientific progress and explores how new approaches to splitting matter created the science of chemistry.(n)

programme.title: The First Georgians: The German Kings Who Made Britain (?)
programme.desc: Dr Lucy Worsley reveals the history of Britain under the reigns of George I and George II, in a programme originally shown to mark the 300th anniversary of the Hanoverian succession to the British throne. She is given access to treasure from the Royal Collection at the Queen's Gallery, Buckingham Palace, to give a personal insight into the monarchs' lives, and begins by charting the story of George I's feuding family.(n)

programme.title: Television's Opening Night: How the Box Was Born (?)
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell, Professor Danielle George and Dr Hugh Hunt mark the 80th anniversary of Britain's very first TV broadcast by trying to recreate the landmark event. The inaugural programme came live from Alexandria Palace on November 2, 1936, but there are no surviving recordings of the show. In response, the presenter trio set out to recreate every aspect of this first broadcast, from the variety acts featured right down to the camera equipment used, using authentic technology and filming techniques. Plus, pioneering TV engineer John Logie Baird's assistant - now aged 104 - is on hand to lend some technical assistance, and Dallas meets a one of the performers who appeared on the first programme to find out what it is like to be part of TV history.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrow's Worlds: The Unearthly History of Science Fiction
programme.desc: Dominic Sandbrook explores the many aspects of the genre and examines its impact on cinema, television and literature. He begins by looking at sci-fi's enduring fascination with outer space, from Jules Verne's pioneering 19th-century vision of a voyage to the moon, to the universe George Lucas created for Star Wars. Along the way, he reveals how Stanley Kubrick made 2001: A Space Odyssey seem so believable and why a man in a dressing gown became one of sci-fi's best-loved heroes in The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy. Featuring contributions by Star Trek's William Shatner and Nichelle Nichols, Anthony Daniels and Kenny Baker from the Star Wars movies, Avatar's Zoe Saldana, Dark Star director John Carpenter and author Neil Gaiman.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: The Changin' Times of Ike White - Arena
programme.desc: Documentary in which Daniel Vernon tries to track down Ike White, a musical prodigy who was serving life in prison for murder when he was given the opportunity to record an album. The resulting record Changin' Times came out in 1976 and following his release from prison, Whiteseemed to be on the path to redemption, but just as he was charting a course to stardom, he disappeared.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross paints an old dirt road leading up to a quaint country barn nestled in nature's greenery.(n)

programme.title: The First Georgians: The German Kings Who Made Britain
programme.desc: Dr Lucy Worsley reveals the history of Britain under the reigns of George I and George II, in a programme originally shown to mark the 300th anniversary of the Hanoverian succession to the British throne. She is given access to treasure from the Royal Collection at the Queen's Gallery, Buckingham Palace, to give a personal insight into the monarchs' lives, and begins by charting the story of George I's feuding family.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross paints a beautiful monochromatic scene with delicate leafless trees and a rich grassy meadow cuddling a sweet cottage.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Ben Garrod explores how skin acts as a barrier between animals and the outside world, shielding them from extremes of temperature, the harmful effects of UV and a host of organisms.(n)

programme.title: Michael Wood's Story of England
programme.sub-title: Henry VIII to the Industrial Revolution
programme.desc: The broadcaster tracks Kibworth's 17th-century dissenters, explores the Grand Union Canal, a waterway that connects Birmingham with London, and discovers the achievements of a pioneering 18th-century feminist writer. The descendants of a highwayman transported to Australia uncover their roots, and the effects of the Industrial Revolution on the village are examined.(n)

programme.title: Climbing Blind
programme.desc: Documentary about Jesse Dufton and his attempt to take on the challenge of becoming the first blind person to lead a climb of the Old Man of Hoy in Orkney, Scotland. At four years of age, Jesse was diagnosed with retinitis pigmentosa, a rare genetic disease that breaks down the retina's cells. When he was 20, Jesse could no longer read. By the time he was 30, he could only detect light, with around a one to two per cent field of view. As a lifelong climber, what Jesse has achieved flies in the face of adversity, training for world cup events and leading traditional rock climbs with his sight guide and fiancee Molly. Now, his attempt on the Old Man of Hoy is testimony to his ambition to take on new and greater challenges, despite his devastating condition.(n)

programme.title: Invasion! With Sam Willis
programme.desc: Sam Willis tells the story of the Barbary Corsaire pirates who made their headquarters on Lundy Island. He also sheds light on the little-known tale of King Louis the Lion, a French King who invaded Britain in the 13th century.(n)

programme.title: The Quest for Bannockburn
programme.desc: Part two of two. Neil Oliver and Tony Pollard conclude their attempt to mark the 700th anniversary of Bannockburn by pinpointing the location of Scotland's most iconic battlefield. They are joined by historians, archaeologists and environmental scientists as they gather evidence to chart the events that ended in Robert the Bruce's overwhelming victory over the English that helped seal Scotland's future as an independent kingdom.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.sub-title: The Mary Rose: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Historian Dan Snow explores the discovery, excavation and raising of the ship, finding out what the latest research has revealed about the vessel and her crew. The presenter also investigates how the project helped create modern underwater archaeology, and examines the techniques, challenges and successes of the divers and archaeologists involved.(n)

programme.title: The Art of Japanese Life
programme.desc: James Fox explores the art of the Japanese home, the clean minimalism of which has been exported round the world from modernist architecture to lifestyle stores.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross paints a beautiful monochromatic scene with delicate leafless trees and a rich grassy meadow cuddling a sweet cottage.(n)

programme.title: David Stratton's Stories of Australian Cinema
programme.desc: How variations on the theme of family are depicted in Australian movie-making The Castle's nuclear, if unorthodox family, a family of faith in The Devil's Playground, Romper Stomper's frightening Neo-Nazis and crime families such as those depicted in Ned Kelly and Animal Kingdom.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints another picture. Today he creates a mountain scene with soft, sloping grass cover, crystal lake and rocky banks.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod examines how animals use their skin to send out messages to their own species, and warning signals to others.(n)

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Elizabeth visits Mr Collins once Charlotte has accepted his proposal of marriage and confides in Jane that she regards him as one of the stupidest men in England. Mrs Bennet sizes up George Wickham as a potential suitor for her daughter - but he has set his heart on society heiress Miss King.(n)

programme.title: Earth from Space
programme.desc: Cameras in space reveal the stories behind Earth's most remarkable patterns and shapes, including fresh water lagoons in Brazil, mysterious light spots in the Australian outback, endless green canopy in the Congo rainforest, and the twists and turns of the Amazon river which provides a home for rehabilitated manatees.(n)

programme.title: Chasing the Moon
programme.sub-title: A Place Beyond the Sky - Part Two
programme.desc: Under Wernher von Braun's leadership, America's technology finally seemed to be catching up with the Soviet Union's. On 5 May 1961, his Redstone rocket successfully launched American navy test pilot Alan Shepard 116 vertical miles into space. The American space programme grew rapidly.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili reveals how Polish astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus's theories about the Earth's orbit were shaped by the discoveries of Islamic scientists. He travels to Syria to observe Ibn Al-Shatir's sundial on the minaret of the Umayyad Mosque in Damascus, before visiting one of the most influential observatories of the Islamic world, Maragheh designed by Al-Tusi. He ends his journey at the Royan Institute in Iran, to investigate how science is now regarded in Islam.(n)

programme.title: The Art of Gothic: Britain's Midnight Hour
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines England's Gothic Revival - an architectural movement that began in the mid-1700s. He starts by exploring its restrained aristocratic beginnings, then reveals how it went on to influence some of Britain's most famous artwork and buildings.(n)

programme.title: Sleuths, Spies & Sorcerers: Andrew Marr's Paperback Heroes
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the conventions of the fantasy genre, profiling key figures including JRR Tolkien, CS Lewis and Terry Pratchett and chatting to best-selling writers Neil Gaiman, Alan Garner and Frances Hardinge.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints another picture. Today he creates a mountain scene with soft, sloping grass cover, crystal lake and rocky banks.(n)

programme.desc: Memorable performances from the BBC archive, featuring singers and musicians from various genres on stage together in shows ranging from Parkinson to the Proms. Featuring appearances by Oscar Peterson, Kiri te Kanawa, Nigel Kennedy, Larry Adler, Bela Fleck and Ballake Sissoko.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Gary Davies hosts the edition first shown on August 31, featuring performances by Damian, Debbie Gibson, Eurythmics, Guns N' Roses, Tears for Fears, Donna Summer and Big Fun.(n)

programme.desc: With cinemas closed and the nation on lockdown, Mark Kermode and Simon Mayo turn their attention to the small screen, presenting a guide to the best - and worst - of streaming culture, across movies and premium TV. Here, they take a critical look at The First Team and I Know This Much Is True.(n)

programme.title: A Musical History
programme.desc: A multi-faceted genius whose music has permeated popular culture, Stevie Wonder is not short of celebrity fans. Here, some well-known fans celebrate the man and his music by selecting some of his best-loved songs. Contributors include actor Martin Freeman, singers Alexander O'Neal, James Morrison, Beverley Knight and Corinne Bailey Rae, New Order's Gillian Gilbert and Stephen Morris, DJs Ana Matronic, Trevor Nelson and Norman Jay, Heaven's 17's Glenn Gregory and Martyn Ware, journalist Sian Pattenden and presenter Emma Dabiri.(n)

programme.desc: As the country prepares for the easing of lockdown, this documentary tells the stories of the elderly and vulnerable people self-isolating during the coronavirus crisis, for whom lockdown may continue for many more months. Featuring people from all over the nation and filmed on location, their stories convey the immense challenge of being especially vulnerable in the midst of a pandemic. Suzanne, who has terminal cancer, has come up with a novel approach to seeing her friends, while Desmond has been forced to move in with his daughter and granddaughter to avoid the virus, which has already taken the lives of at least four of his friends.(n)

programme.desc: Sharon and Shaun Garner help Debbie from Buckingham to find a holiday home in Almeria. Ian Cochrane from Fife turns to Linda Rodriguez and her daughter Charlotte - a property tour novice - for help in his search for a property in Alicante province.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Margaret Mountford joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Elvis fan Sandra and her husband Desmond seek help in their search for their dream holiday home near Mar Menor's stunning beaches on Spain's Costa Calida. They would ideally like a property with three bedrooms for when their family come to visit. Danni Menzies has five options for their £150,000 budget, but whether the couple will be impressed enough to put in an offer remains to be seen.(n)

programme.title: Work on the Wild Side
programme.desc: It's a big day for the vets and volunteers, as Harriet is called out to an emergency operation on an elephant whose leg has been wounded by a poacher's snare. Volunteer Debbie is put to the test as nine orphaned baby monkeys arrive at once, and Emma becomes surrogate mum to three-week-old baby hippo, Hector.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bromley, south-east London, Jo and her discerning foodie partner Alex kick off proceedings with a fine dining menu but the guests are not impressed. Day two sees Ryan and Julie go back to their roots cooking up an Americana menu, but the food fails to wow with Michelle comparing the main course to vomit. Finally it's the turn of Michelle and confident Craig, who give their guests a taste of the Caribbean.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa takes up ice hockey and proves so good at the game that she completely transforms her ailing team's fortunes. Dismayed at being outshone by a girl, Bart tries to compensate by becoming a teacher's pet - only to be beaten up by bullies.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Marge attend a confectionery convention, where they plan to make off with lots of free sweets. programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.desc: Things are far from normal as the Bafta-nominated entertainment show continues its re-fashioned series for lockdown. programme.desc: A toddler is rushed in with suspected sepsis, a life-threatening condition that attacks the organs, and a large team of specialists administer high-strength antibiotics. programme.desc: Documentary examining the lifestyles of some of those living on benefits who are not currently seeking employment, including a Gloucestershire mother-of-11 who receives benefits equivalent to three times the typical UK family income. programme.desc: The documentary explores the lives of straight sex workers who have turned their heterosexual predilections upside down to perform in gay roles for money. programme.desc: Two more families swap homes, budgets and lifestyles for a week to see how the other half lives. For Matthew and Belinda Sethard-Wright and their two children, this means exchanging their large house in Orpington for a Bromley council house. Moving into their home will be Skye Walker and her three children. As a professional housekeeper, Skye works in houses not unlike the Sethard-Wrights'. programme.desc: In east London, Karen and Peter run a sting operation to catch out passengers fraudulently using discounted travel passes, while Dan solves the case of a long-running scam at Southwark station. programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.sub-title: Paddington: A Year on the Tracks
programme.desc: The summer heat has caused a points failure at Didcot, leaving the Paddington team anxious that the problem gets resolved in time for rush hour. British Transport Police are not impressed when a young man jumps onto the tracks to retrieve a sleeping bag seconds before a 400 ton train rolls by, while in Teignmouth, the line has to be closed when an unexploded Second World War bomb is discovered just over 200m from the station.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Tube: Going Underground
programme.desc: Rob Bell examines the history of the Central Line, which at 46 miles is the longest in the Tube's network and connects east with west - transporting 260 million passengers a year. Rob learns that Bank's platforms are curved to avoid the Bank of England's vaults, and investigates a disaster during the Second World War in which 173 people were killed at Bethnal Green station while trying to shelter from an air raid.(n)

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc: Officers attending a notorious pub where a man has been found with facial wounds following an assault, but none of the customers admit to having seen anything or want to talk about what happened, so CCTV footage is analysed to try to piece together the case. Meanwhile, police are dispatched by a call handler when a woman reports she is being threatened in her car by four men in balaclavas.(n)

programme.title: World's Toughest Prisons

At 32, Kat Fleming-Scott is a late starter at driving, but her husband Chris's map-reading leaves a lot to be desired when he gets them hopelessly lost in Liverpool, while Weymouth mother-of-four Lauren Foster has lessons from her spouse Adam, who believes men are much the better drivers. programme.sub-title: Hitler's Invisible U-Boat: Draining the Ocean
programme.desc: Marine archaeologists and historians go in search of Hitler's secrets, hidden deep underwater, revealing how the Nazis waged a secret war across the world's oceans. This documentary uses CGI graphics to drain the oceans and investigate the lost wrecks of the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in the mountaintop town of Creel, the Chihuahua Pacifico Express - or El Chepe for short - winds its way through the Tarahumara Mountains, home to the reclusive Raramuri people. Divisadero, Mexico's most panoramic station, offers the first glimpse of Copper Canyon. Created by six separate yet conjoined gorges, it is four times the size of the Grand Canyon. The train continues on to the Urique Canyon, which at 6,200ft deep it is the deepest in North America. The final leg crosses the state of Sinaloa, Mexico's breadbasket, before reaching Los Mochis and the gateway to the Pacific Ocean. Narrated by Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Portillo's Empire Journey
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Jamaica, the Caribbean capital of the Empire, heading to Fort Charles where the Empire enlisted the help of pirates to defend the new territory from the Spanish. At the old naval headquarters, Michael learns how the Royal Navy moved in to replace the pirates as Britain struck a deal with Spain to keep her territories. The island needed a new source of wealth, and found it in the triangular trade as slaves were shipped from Africa to work sugar plantations. In Pinnacle, birthplace of the Rastafari movement, Michael learns how Jamaicans were later inspired to create a new religion.(n)

programme.title: When... Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.sub-title: When Comedy Shows Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Julian Clary narrates a compilation of disastrous mishaps from comedy shows. Featuring a stunt fight that ended badly for comedian Russell Howard, an incident that left Tony Hancock determined to never perform live again, and a rare outtake from Tom, Dick and Harriet. That long-forgotten sitcom from 1982 and 1983 featured former Return of the Saint star Ian Ogilvy and actor/director Lionel Jeffries. Their stunt involving a partly submerged car could have ended in disaster.(n)
